text: Have any of you had issues with creating staged pages? We have a portal, where we can only make new staged pages for Landing Pages, even though the portal has access to Website Pages.
Hey Guys, Quick one. Unsure if it can be done or not. Can you write PHP into the HubSpot Designer manager?
PHP wont work with HubSpot (at least that i know of)
Definitely no PHP in HubSpot
Right okay. Thanks for that. Thats bugged up the plans
is there something you are trying to achieve in particular?
I'd like to build a search feature with an event calendar
Does the portal have HubDB? That would probably be the easiest way. Otherwise, totally doable in JS
+1 for using HubDB for event calendar
I'll investigate and look for some pure JS tutorials for search features. Previously used both PHP and Ajax to build but that was in WordPress
canâ€™t get what you need using hubl?

Ajax is still available client-side, you could integrate with a database service like Firebase for querying (albeit there will be a half-second added for the response) or even something like querying a Google Sheet if the dataset is simple enough
Quite new to HS, so need to investigate how hubl works, but the above info sounds promising enough. Thanks guys :thumbsup:
<https://javascript30.com/> Check out the day 6 tutorial
oo, cool beans
All of Wes Bos' stuff is pretty rad, this series is great and also free
(shameless promotion for the guy that taught me how to code)
Seen a few tutorials from Wes before, will definitely check this out :thumbsup:

that's awesome; I've been wanting to break out of frameworks for a while, but never really given myself a chance to. Always catching myself going back and forth between "no, that's how you write it in React/Vue/Babel/jQuery/whatever else" to the point where writing vanilla feels weird lol. "One language for everything," sure...
I still tend to rely a little too heavily on jQuery, but stuff like this makes me really question why.

On HubSpot sites, why not, they host is and it's fast as heck to load. But we've found ourselves building static prototypes a lot recently for site redesigns and deploying them on directly CDNs for client testing/approval, and on those every byte counts. It took me embarrassingly long the other day to toggle between header classes on click the other day because I couldn't remember the vanilla DOM API off the top of my head. #duh
has anyone else had random issues with favicons?
I've had to delete in settings and re-select the file in at least 2 client portals now...in one case I had to delete in file manager and re-upload it
Yup, I've had a portal or two where it looks to be pointing to someone else's favicon location
the one I had to delete and re-upload looked to be doing the same
wasn't what looked like some red buildings, was it?
nah, it was a yellow up arrow
strange
indeed...
<@U22PWJ41G> is this something we should notify someone about? Or are y'all aware of this happening to others?
Can you send an example if you still have one?
sorry, I don't...we fixed the issue both times but I can send you the portal IDs if that's of any use
same deal here
will keep my eye out for if it happens again though
same here

Someone posted a good question on the design forum and I wanted to send this here as i think it values conversation about it. I know if i was asked this my only response would be HubDB but that doesnt help if they dont need it. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Content-Design-Questions/Landing-Pages-vs-Website-Platform/m-p/181600#M5132>
HubDB, as you point out, is one piece. Content Staging is also only available with the Website Add-on.

We have been talking about differentiating these (in terms of functionality users get if they have the add-on versus don't have it) internally. But nothing has been decided or is imminently happening at this point.
Interesting, it seems if they have a small site then (like a few pages) then there would be no real reason for them to go the website add-on route unless they needed either HubDB or Content Staging
Agreed. Would love anyone's thoughts on how we could better differentiate these (or for that matter, if you even think we should).
I've recently been considering moving website pages over to landing pages to access A/B testing functionality.
I'd love to see this functionality in Website pages
For sure, <@U54TVT3C1>. That's something on our radar as well.
i think making it more clear that you can have a website with HubSpot without the website add-on would open the door for a lot more folks
This is an incredibly timely conversation, glad itâ€™s happening! Personally, Iâ€™d love to hear any and all feedback on how you all feel this _should_ work.
(for perspective, <@U3VN3LMME> is the Product Manager responsible for our Website Add-on/CMS, so please send feedback to him and I)

my 2 cents: sell hubdb and site staging separately as a premium website-addon. include site pages with the basic plan (or just don't differentiate landing pages/site pages since they aren't any different besides terminology/organization purposes)
I was just trying to figure out how to say that, they are basically the same thing. I love the idea of that (hubdb and staging as the "website addon".

*EMAIL INTEGRATION*
Itâ€™s now easy to integrate email with Office 365, GMAIL or IMAP
But how can I proceed to integrate an exchange server that is not in Office ? 
Itâ€™s a 1and1 exchange server like <http://1.exchange.1and1.eu|1.exchange.1and1.eu>
Do you have any idea ?
i'd say you could go one step further and add in the A/B testing to be part of the add on as well then roll out A/B to both landing and website pages

^ I agree with the above, only other thing to take into account are the multiple subdomains. If we have basic with no website addon, can we still have landing pages on info. or offers. or another subdomain? That was the biggest technical difference I saw between the two.
(adding a few other folks to chime-in: <@U25PYL3Q8>, <@U25EHAP7G>, <@U38EZFVFE>, <@U26C29XPH>)
Very very interesting topic ! Thanks everyone. Dynamic pages with Hubdb is the main reason I use Website Page and not LP. A/B test on WP will be very usefull.
It's probably good to reach out to the Support team on this (unless any other agencies/devs have dealt with it as well).
Could you use dynamic pages with a landing page though? I mean the hubdb setting is on the landing page to right?
Thanks <@U22PU4G4A> :slightly_smiling_face: I will do it. I have first the reflex of community before using HS support.
Yes youâ€™re right <@U2H3TT8F2> . Dynamic Page option is available on LP...

What is the impact on your overall conversion rate if you were to place all your pages on LP and not website pages. Pages that aren't meant to convert now are going to have views bringing your overall conversion rate down.  As a side note I've been trying to figure out how to loop a conversion on a page that doesn't really convert.  --how can I tie an event to report back to HubSpot to say "this was converted"  This is more or less for outside scripts
Do you get a blog with landing pages only?
@yeah, blog and landing pages is the base package.
landing pages dont get added to the Sitemap by default. Be careful with that.
<@U26BLKGE4> re: subdomains -- do you see any need for placing pages on subdomains if their website is on a HubSpot domain? Have a use case for it?
not specifically, just what we've always done and are used to selling/servicing.
gotcha. I mostly try to avoid it unless they have a WP site or some other website that isn't in HubSpot.

I would offer to hear "pricing alternatives" if you wanted to test them out as some companies do <@U3VN3LMME> <@U22PU4G4A> -- overall I think separating hubdb and anything else as an add on available to both landing pages and website pages would be good

I'd also say that just using landing pages is kind of a cheap hack around to saving money if they are placing their entire website on there -- but software is made for a specific purpose and then people do whatever they want with it

We have have run into other sites that have done this before. As <@U25PYL3Q8> stated it throws off reporting metrics and I don't think anyone mentioned this but any website analytics wont be recorded either for the new reproting HS is doing there. To be honest though that reporting is so thin i dont bother looking at it there I use GA for those metrics but for your basic markter they might prefer to see them there. 

The other issues we saw is that it made the backed of the LP's a mess.
by backend i mean the organization

Hi all, I recently created this training on the new Design Manager and wanted to share it with all of you. Its a quick overview of what's changed, where to find things, etc. Feel free to go through it yourselves, or pass it along to any colleagues/clients who need to get up to speed on all the changes. <https://rise.articulate.com/share/gL5qPg4wopTBJTJMOQKYrdOoKKbZ8nnA>
Very cool, nice design too. This will come in handy to get my co-workers up to speed on it.

Glad to hear that, Jon! We used this format as well for the Content Strategy launch and it worked extremely well. Admittedly, the Content Strategy training was internal-only and we should have released it for partners as well, but if you (and others) find this format helpful we can continue to produce and share these when we have larger-scale launches like the new Design Manager. cc: <@U87NGNETZ>.

I'd agree with some of the early feedback I saw. I'd love to see Site Pages included for ALL customers as a base level (plus it would help drive adoption of the CMS or might be that last little push WordPress users need to migrate their site). Plus it puts HubSpot more directly in a position to compete with WordPress. WP is free other than the hosting. I look at it kind of the same way with HS. Have the CMS free because people are already paying for the "hosting" via their marketing subscription. Obviously HubSpot I'm sure has data that probably shows users of the CMS are generally more "sticky" just like those who get the CRM. Having HubDB as an add-on I think makes more sense then to have the entire website pages tool as the add-on. I'm a little hesitant to say that I think Content Staging should be a paid add-on. I don't think most non-developer/non-agency customers really understand the value of Content Staging (look how many years we had gone without it on HubSpot) and I can see a lot of them feeling like they can make do without it.

The wrinkle I'm sure that gets thrown into this is what do you do with the past idea I know has been floated about offering a standalone HubSpot CMS product.
Maybe Personalization, A/B Testing and HubDB are part of the HubSpot CMS Add-On and but then Site Pages itself is free? I can see that being a good differentiator between the 2 options.
There were some issues with favicons getting mixed up last week. It should be all resolved now though. If you still see it, let us know.

Does anyone here use a Drift Bot on their site that is currently booking meetings? Weâ€™re noticing that when people submit though the bot, it is not tracking as a submission on the page level, but is on the form level, not sure if anyone has found a solution to this, but Iâ€™d love to hear!

Hey <@U7AU6414J> it might be worth posting in this Drift Facebook Group as well. There's a lot of HubSpot/Drift users there and I've seen quite a few conversations lately about the integration between the 2.
<https://www.facebook.com/groups/learndrift/>
Thanks <@U26C29XPH>! A coworker is already doing so!
Great points, Josh. I'm curious for folks in this thread -- how much of a factor is personalization (Smart Content), HubDB, and A/B testing a part of your "pitch" to get clients onto the HubSpot CMS?
We definitely incorporate Growth Driven Design in our pitch.  Data from A/B testing is super valuable in that process
Also, the customers we deal with are always excited about a data-driven approach to site improvements
HubDB hasn't been huge for us yet, but the use cases we've found for it so far have made our clients very happy.
<@U7AU6414J> We've got the integrations working and tracking by form submitted on the page works in smart lists. The conversations have to be closed to push all the information.
<@U54TVT3C1> I'd like to create a new thread next week to talk about GDD, I don't want to derail this current conversation. I'll tag you in it after I get my thoughts collected.
Look forward to seeing that thread <@U25PYL3Q8>. Interested to hear your thoughts (and everyone else's).

<@U22PU4G4A> Over the past few years I've been removed from being involved in these talks so I'll have trouble responding with any real data. But, I'd like to say <@U26C29XPH> brings up really valid points.  I believe content staging is very important. I think this should be included in anything. I think that this should be taught and beat into the way a page is developed. I think this is missing in the way other websites are developed -- it may not be something you can pitch as a must have, because it isn't something that anyone else really does well. They don't know they need this.
This thread's so good we need sub-threads.
LOL this is so right. this fits better in a reddit thread then a slack channel
/r/HubSpotdevs

I think when we get to add ons we are talking about larger clients. I think larger clients are willing to use those add ons when they are necessary. So things like hubdb, shopify integration, smart content, a/b testing is for those bigger clients. From a partner standpoint these things can be sold later on when the need arrives or when we scope that it is needed. From a client coming to HS, I think the extra that is there isn't needed.  I also think HS could do better with A/B testing. A/B testing is okay if you have no idea what is going to work, but once you have something working an A/B test can kill conversions.  Say you have a nice converting page and you make a change, now you are putting your awesome converting page at risk by splitting that up in a 50/50 type arrangement.  This isn't the way we should be a/b testing in today's internet.  We should be doing something like 80% (somewhere in there) on the page that converts well, then compare the other 20% as the new page.

I can't speak for sq2 as a whole, but I see us doing a/b testing on our website because we have massive amounts of traffic compared with some of our clients, and then take our results and pass them down. I think it may be valuable to HS clients if they understand it, and I'm sure some take advantage of it but I think the implementation of it in HS isn't the right way and should be discussed internally at HS.

I think some new threads need to be made about some of these add ons so we can discuss as partners how we use them and reflect on how clients without HS would use them or do use them to really get some good insight on what is valuable at what price point.
I think each module/feature needs it's own channel for some.
